page.title: 07FARMING -Size and Produce
page.content: Tile Farm Barn includes part of Brockenhurst Park and comprises 475 acres of which 350 acres are used for pasture for sheep, cattle and pigs and for horses kept as pets - there are show jumping fences in one field. Barley, oats and hay are grown on a rotation system. Chickens also are kept. Produce is sold to a local butcher and at Salisbury market. Holly Bush Farm comprises 7 acres of which 2.5 acres are leased for 25 years (from 1st May 1985) to a market gardener who is growing soft fruit, vegetables, bedding plants and shrubs. One acre is under grass. 90% of the general produce is sold to the general public and the rest to hotels, landscape gardeners etc. The landowner is developing a vineyard in the grounds.
